intro: Knorringia sibirica, commonly known as Siberian knorringia, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of northern Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subarctic regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
